Key_Evidence: • Confirms the flight landed more than 15 minutes early, triggering the early-arrival condition | • Gate B24 identified; controller immediately cautions that they may need to call ramp – hinting gate is still occupied because aircraft arrived far ahead of plan | • Pilot has reached the ramp area only two minutes after landing but cannot proceed straight in, indicating the gate is not yet available | • Ramp places the aircraft on a holding spot (spot 1), a common procedure when gate will open once the scheduled aircraft pushes | • Shows the aircraft waited roughly an hour so that it blocked-in exactly at scheduled time, consistent with an early-arrival-driven gate wait

Key_Evidence: • Explicit SuperTug/'under tow' call-out shows an arrival aircraft (United 643) being towed through the Foxtrot alley, confirming an active tow-off operation | • SKW5313 reports extended hold after landing, waiting specifically for gate F8; indicates the gate itself is open but access is blocked | • Ramp control confirms SKW5313 cannot taxi in yet, implying ongoing blocking activity (tow) inside the alley | • Ramp explicitly states 'traffic in the alleyway'—tow operation traffic—prevented immediate access | • Only after the tow traffic clears is SKW5313 released toward the alley
